Query.SqlString: SELECT Top 32767 ID,Literature FROM Literature WHERE (Literature ='PA98')

BibliographicData.Title: Organization of the intrinsic connections of the monkey amygdaloid complex: Projections originating in the lateral nucleus

BrainSite.FullName: Accessory basal (magnocellular) nucleus of the amygdala
Accessory basal amygdaloid nucleus, parvicellular part
Nucleus of the lateral olfactory tract
basal nucleus (paralaminar division of the amygdala)

Reference.Quotation: "Location of PHA-L injections in the lateral nucleus The locations of injection sites in the different divisions of the lateral nucleus are summarized in Table 1 and are illustrated in Figure 4. In two cases, the injection involved mainly the dorsal division (cases M7-91 and M10-90; a few cells were also labeled in the intermediate division of the basal nucleus, the anterior amygdaloid area, and the rostral paralaminar nucleus). Six injections were located in the dorsal intermediate division (cases M9-90; M8-89; M8-89; M2-90; in which a few labeled cells were also located in the ventromedial putamen; and M20-89). In case M11-91, labeled neurons were located within the lateral nucleus but were uncharacteristically distributed for nearly 4-5 mm dorsoventrally along the pipette tract. Most fo the labeled cells, however, were located in the dorsal and dorsal intermediate divisions. Three injections were located in the ventral intermediate division (cases M13-91, M15-91, and M1-91), anf five were in the ventral division (case M3-90, in which a few cells were located in the paralaminar nucleus ventrally adjacent to the lateral nucleus; and cases M6-90, M11-88, M5-91, and M6-91). Taken together, the injetions involved all divisions of the lateral nucleus and essentially all rostrocaudal levels of the nucleus." (p. 437)

"Location of PHA-L injections in the lateral nucleus The locations of injection sites in the different divisions of the lateral nucleus are summarized in Table 1 and are illustrated in Figure 4. In two cases, the injection involved mainly the dorsal division (cases M7-91 and M10-90; a few cells were also labeled in the intermediate division of the basal nucleus, the anterior amygdaloid area, and the rostral paralaminar nucleus). Six injections were located in the dorsal intermediate division (cases M9-90; M8-89; M8-89; M2-90; in which a few labeled cells were also located in the ventromedial putamen; and M20-89). In case M11-91, labeled neurons were located within the lateral nucleus but were uncharacteristically distributed for nearly 4-5 mm dorsoventrally along the pipette tract. Most fo the labeled cells, however, were located in the dorsal and dorsal intermediate divisions. Three injections were located in the ventral intermediate division (cases M13-91, M15-91, and M1-91), anf five were in the ventral division (case M3-90, in which a few cells were located in the paralaminar nucleus ventrally adjacent to the lateral nucleus; and cases M6-90, M11-88, M5-91, and M6-91). Taken together, the injetions involved all divisions of the lateral nucleus and essentially all rostrocaudal levels of the nucleus." (p. 437)

"Location of PHA-L injections in the lateral nucleus The locations of injection sites in the different divisions of the lateral nucleus are summarized in Table 1 and are illustrated in Figure 4. Most fo the labeled cells, however, were located in the dorsal and dorsal intermediate divisions. Three injections were located in the ventral intermediate division (cases M13-91, M15-91, and M1-91), anf five were in the ventral division (case M3-90, in which a few cells were located in the paralaminar nucleus ventrally adjacent to the lateral nucleus; and cases M6-90, M11-88, M5-91, and M6-91). Taken together, the injetions involved all divisions of the lateral nucleus and essentially all rostrocaudal levels of the nucleus." (p. 437)
